PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
1.  A project preparatory technical assistance (PPTA) is required to support the Ministry of 
New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) and Solar Energy Corporation of India Limited (SECI) to 
structure the proposed Concentrated Solar Power Project and carry out required project due 
diligence on technical, economic, financial, legal and safeguard aspects. The PPTA will also 
assess and review the capacity requirements of SECI to facilitate and monitor implementation of 
concentrated solar power (CSP) sub-projects. The PPTA is included in ADB’s India Country 
Operations Business Plan (COBP) 2013-2015.1 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
2.  The outputs of the PPTA will be the timely execution of bidding process for two CSP 
demonstration sub-projects and capacity development of SECI. The major outputs and activities 
are summarized in Table A4.1.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
3.  The PPTA is estimated to cost $1,000,000 equivalent, which will be financed on a grant 
basis by the Multi-Donor Clean Energy Fund2 under the Clean Energy Financing Partnership 
Facility and administered by ADB. The Government will provide in kind support.

D.  Consulting Services 
5.  A consulting firm will be recruited for the PPTA with total positions and person-months 
as indicated in Table A4.3. Taking into consideration the complexity of the investment program, 
the firm will be recruited using quality and cost based selection methodology with a 90:10 
technical-cost  weighting  based  on  a  simplified  technical  proposal.  The  consulting  firm  will 
conduct technical, economic, financial, and governance due diligence, prepare project cost 
estimates, procurement plan and implementation schedule. The international environmental and 
social development specialists will be recruited on an individual basis to ensure that that they 
start their field activities at the right time in the process. Consultants will be recruited following 
Guidelines on the Use of Consultants by ADB and Its Borrowers, March 2013.

E.  Implementation Arrangements 
7.  MNRE  will  be  the  project's  executing  agency  and  provide  key  inputs  and  in-kind 
contributions in the form of office accommodation, support facilities, counterpart staff, maps, 
reports, and other logistical support. SECI will be the implementing agency of the project. 
Disbursements  under  the  TA  would  be  in  accordance  with  ADB’s  Technical  Assistance 
Handbook (May 2010, as amended).  
 
8.  The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table A4.4.  
 
Table A4.4: Proposed Technical Assistance Processing and Implementation Schedule
